page.title: 06Farming Ponders Lodge
page.content: Ponders Lodge Farm is situated in the Fyfield area. The farmhouse dates back to the l6th century. It is at present occupied by Miss Boyton and her sister Mrs. Wheel who used to teach in the village school. Miss Boyton has lived in the area all her life. Her father owned the farm before she took it over in l942. She owns l40 acres of land growing wheat, barley and rape. She makes good use of her garden. She has 20 crossbreed cows and some chickens. She employs one person. The equipment mainly consists of plough, drill and a cultivator, three Fordson tractors. Miss Boyton considers that the most important changes have been the use of the combine harvester and crop spraying.
